Annual Report of the Monetary Board 2021
In terms of Section 35 of the Monetary Law Act (Chapter 422), within four months
after  the  end  of  each  financial  year,  the  Monetary  Board  of  the  Central  Bank  of
Sri  Lanka  is  required  to  submit  an  Annual  Report  to  the  Honourable  Minister
of Finance on the condition of the Central Bank and a review of the policies and
measures adopted by the Monetary Board during the financial year and an analysis
of  the  economic  and  financial  circumstances  which  prompted  those  policies  and
The Seventy Second Annual Report of the Monetary Board of the Central Bank, in
respect of the year 2021, is submitted herewith in fulfilment of this obligation.
